abstract: After Facebook's I.P.O., people made rich by the company's success aren't likely to sit on the sidelines. Instead, The New York Times' Somini Sengupta reports, early Facebook employees and other successful Silicon Valley entrepreneurs are likely to reinvest in new companies, aided by what Bill Tai, a partner at Charles River Ventures, calls the "dense set of overlapping spider webs" that is the social fabric of the start-up scene.

headline.main: How Silicon Valley Uses Riches to Reinvest
